frameDefinitions: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator wrongs a Victim by taking something (Goods) from them.
These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a  Victim or a Source.
An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
A Searcher looks all over a Ground in order to find a Sought_entity.

This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (Side_1 and Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as Sides) over a disputed Issue and/or in order to reach a specific  Purpose. '' 'He still wants to fight Mike Tyson in about 8 months.'
frameExamples: Half of the team <t>held</t> <t>up</t> the tellers while the others were stationed to report the arrival of police.
I can't believe he <t>pickpocketed</t> my gold watch !
As soon as he stepped out of the bar he was <t>set</t> upon by four men in ski-masks.
The newcomers <t>combed</t> the area looking for minerals
He still wants to <t>fight</t> Mike Tyson in about 8 months.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the <fen>Goods</fen> away by force or threats.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the <fen>Goods</fen> before they are taken away by the <fen>Perpetrator</fen>.
Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
The <fen>Time</fen> indicates when the Robbery occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the Robbery occurs.
<fen>Perpetrator</fen> is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away.
<fen>Victim</fen> is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away.
<fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the goods, before they change location.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the theft occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the theft occurs.
This role is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The person who is looking all over the <fen>Ground</fen> for the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The location that the <fen>Searcher</fen> covers in looking for the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Searcher</fen> wants to find.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Searcher</fen> scoures the <fen>Ground</fen>.
One of two participants in a hostile encounter.
One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned.
The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter.
An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement.

The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the <fen>Side_1</fen> or for all the <fen>Sides</fen> collectively.  It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g.
The <fex name='Time'>Time</fex> at which the hostile encounter occurs.
The location at which the hostile encounter takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Leslie</fex> robbed Kim of her watch.
Leslie robbed <fex>Kim</fex> of her watch.
Leslie and Kim robbed <fex>a bank</fex>
They ROBBED a bank in North Berkeley <fex>last May</fex>.
They robbed a bank <fex>in North Berkeley</fex>.
<fex>Leslie</fex> stole the watch from Kim.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from Kim</fex>.
Leslie STOLE <fex>the watch</fex> from Kim.
Leslie stole the watch <fex>from the table</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>at dusk</fex>.
Leslie STOLE the watch from Kim <fex>in the park</fex>.
The mysterious fighter attacked <fex>the guardsmen</fex> with a sabre.
<fex>The mysterious fighter</fex> attacked the guardsmen with a sabre.
<fex>As soon as he stepped out of the bar</fex> he was set upon by four men in ski-masks.
Then Jon-O's forces ambushed them <fex>on the left flank</fex> from a line of low hills.
<fex>They</fex> first gained entry into the house of Raja Rao, who resides on the ground floor and ransacked the house for valuables.
I had never really seen much on the bigfoot subject or I would have scoured <fex>the area</fex> for signs and looked for droppings
Coast Guard and Navy ships and aircraft combed the area <fex>for the six aircraft</fex>
While <fex>the U.S.'s</fex> battle with terrorist-harboring nations is far off ...
While the U.S.'s battle <fex>with terrorist-harboring nations</fex> is far off ...
<fex>They</fex> fought over the right to own land.
They had a dust-up <fex>over who was prettier</fex> .
He dueled with his former second <fex>to defend the honour of the man he had killed</fex> .
Following the battle of Naseby <fex>in 1645</fex> he died.
Following the battle <fex>of Naseby</fex> in 1645 ...
